definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: During that project, the new torch was carefully covered with thin sheets of 24k gold.
sentences.chinese: 在修复工程中，新的火炬由24K纯金薄片仔细覆盖。

sentences.english: One has a two-ton Buddha made of solid gold!
sentences.chinese: 其中有一间庙有一座由两吨纯金打造成的佛陀。

sentences.english: It was small and dainty, and of pure gold.
sentences.chinese: 这只鞋又小又漂亮，是纯金打造的。

sentences.english: Complte Gold Mercedez Benz Value 9 Million US.
sentences.chinese: 纯金奔驰轿车，价值9百万美元。

sentences.english: With buckles of the purest gold.
sentences.chinese: 镶上精致扣带，用纯金做成。

sentences.english: The trophy was made of pure gold with a base of semiprecious stones.
sentences.chinese: 奖杯用纯金制作，底座镶有一些不算太贵重的宝石。

sentences.english: Wang said sales of pure gold jewellery at Caishikou were stable.
sentences.chinese: 王春丽说菜市口的纯金饰品的销售额相当稳定。

sentences.english: The topaz of Cush cannot compare with it; it cannot be bought with pure gold.
sentences.chinese: 雇士的黄玉不足与她相比，纯金也不能与她较量。

sentences.english: Paradise Square, pure natural "gold series" very suitable aunt use.
sentences.chinese: 永乐坊的纯自然的“纯金系列”很适宜伯母用。

sentences.english: It's made of gold and in the middle there's a big green emerald.
sentences.chinese: 它是纯金打造的，在中间镶嵌着一大颗绿宝石。

sentences.english: They made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
sentences.chinese: 用纯金把桌子包裹，替桌子的四周做了金牙边。

sentences.english: A talent of pure gold was used for the lampstand and its various appurtenances .
sentences.chinese: 为做灯台和一切用具，用了一塔冷通纯金。

sentences.english: They shall be set upon the most pure candlestick before the Lord continually.
sentences.chinese: 亚郎应把这些灯放在纯金台上，在上主面前长燃不熄。

definition: variant of 鎦金|镏金[liu2 jin1]
brass (alloy of copper 銅|铜[tong2] and zinc 鋅|锌[xin1])
to gild/(old) wages paid to a performer or a troupe by a theater

pinyin: Shi1 hua2 luo4 shi4 qi2 shui3 jing1

definition: copper (pure copper, as opposed to alloy)
to inlay/to embed/to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring)/tiling/tesselation
to gold-plate/to gild/(fig.) to make sth quite ordinary seem special
